entry.title: City of Santa Monica Bitcoin Office to Host Open-Source Bitcoin Festival In October
entry.summary:
The City of Santa Monica's Bitcoin Office has announced a one-day Bitcoin open-source festival scheduled for October 18th, with the date subject to change. The event, held in partnership with the Proof of Workforce Foundation, aims to provide education on various aspects of Bitcoin, including mining, investment, and the broader implications of Bitcoin in the economy.
🎡 We are excited to learn about #Bitcoin Peer-to-Peer …⚡️⚡️⚡️ Please Join Us! Follow @SMBitcoinOffice for official updates and more information soon…Dates subject to change pic.twitter.com/hcgCgQUOaf — Santa Monica Bitcoin Office (@SMBitcoinOffice) August 9, 2024
The Santa Monica Bitcoin Office, which was launched last month following a unanimous city council vote, is dedicated to educating the local community about the transformative potential of Bitcoin. The office also aims to identify and facilitate Bitcoin industry partnerships to support Santa Monica's economic recovery and create new employment opportunities. By fostering strategic collaborations and positioning Santa Monica as a hub for Bitcoin innovation, the city hopes to attract investment and ensure economic resilience in the digital age. The upcoming festival is part of this broader mission, offering residents and businesses an opportunity to engage with the latest developments in Bitcoin.
NEW: Giant #Bitcoin symbol lit up on the Santa Monica Pier ferris wheel in California 🇺🇸 pic.twitter.com/MHOUor8pzK — Bitcoin Magazine (@BitcoinMagazine) July 11, 2024
However, the city and its partners have made it clear that any discussions at the event should not be interpreted as financial advice. The Santa Monica Bitcoin Office said participants are encouraged to conduct their own research and consult financial advisors before making any investment decisions. In June, 2023, the Santa Monica firefighters also became the first union to purchase and hold Bitcoin, thanks to a partnership with the Proof of Workforce Foundation.

However, Eleanor reports that the meeting quickly devolved into a heated airing of grievanc…

entry.title: ‘Crypto For Harris’ 2024 US Election Campaign Branded A Fraud
entry.summary:
Proponents of the “Crypto for Harris” may find the political terrain a rough patch to navigate as some sectors have labeled the US election campaign as a fraud.
According to detractors of US Vice President Kamala Harris, the group lobbying for her and attaching the word “crypto” as a battlecry of sorts think it is aimed at swaying digital currency voters in the US presidential showdown this year.
The campaign coincides with the Democratic party advocating a “reset” on Vice President Kamala Harris’ crypto posture.
Cryptocurrency advocates, such as Balaji Srinivasan, who formerly served as the Chief Technology Officer of Coinbase, have lamented the campaign’s lack of substance.
A ‘Dem Scam’?
Srinivasan didn’t mince words against Harris, claiming the Democratic Party were wrong to…

entry.title: Big News For Ripple: SEC Signals No Plans To Appeal Ruling
entry.summary:
The US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) has signaled it will not appeal Wednesday’s ruling by Judge Torres in the legal battle with Ripple. The case concluded on August 7 with the company facing a civil penalty significantly less than the SEC originally demanded.
Judge Torres’s decision mandated a $125 million civil penalty for securities violations related to sales to institutions, along with a disgorgement of $0. This is a stark contrast to the approximately $2 billion in damages initially sought by the SEC. Additionally, an injunction was imposed to prevent further violations of Section 5 of the Securities Act.
SEC Breaks Silence On Ripple Ruling
While Ripple’s executives immediately commented on the ruling via X, celebrating the ruling as a victory, the US agency remained…

entry.title: Putin Legalizes Crypto Mining, Ushering In A New Era For Russia
entry.summary:
Russian President Vladimir Putin has signed a law on Thursday, officially giving legal status for crypto mining in the country.
This historic law not only brings Russia into the global crypto economy but also sets in motion a legislative blueprint to prevent illegal activity, so ensuring the nation stays both a player and a watchdog in the digital financial scene.
New Regulations For Crypto Miners
According to multiple news outlets, the new legislation, set to go into effect this November, gives registered legal firms and individual entrepreneurs exclusive rights to mine cryptocurrencies in an attempt to balance innovation and control.
There is, however, a break for the small players: people who stay within certain government-set energy consumption limits can mine without having …

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 167 - CHATTING TO DOODLES!
entry.summary: BTC nears $70k after Trump speech, PoW alts soar. Crypto funds saw $245m inflows last week. Open Interest on BTC hits record $39.4bn. SOL overtakes ETH in several key metrics. Pump(.)fun overtakes ETH for daily revenue. Jito overtakes Lido for fees collected. $1.5bn altcoin unlocks in August, $600m XRP. Compound DAO faces $25m governance attack. JUP vote to reduce supply 30% is this week. JUP vote to reduce supply 30% is this week.

entry.title: New Technology Is Making Bionic Limbs More Affordable
entry.summary: Alt Bionics founder and CEO Ryan Saavedra talks with Decrypt's Jason Nelson about the Genesis Hand, an affordable $5,000 bionic limb designed for daily use.

entry.title: The Story of Solana Meme Coin Billy
entry.summary: Billy is the largest Solana meme coin on Pumpdotfun, peaking at a market cap of over $200 million. But it wasn’t always smooth sailing. Minutes after launching Billy’s dev abandoned him and sold the majority of their tokens. At the time, the tokens were worth $1,116 but at today’s value they’d be worth more than $8.65 million.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 166 - CRYPTO AND STOCKS FALL
entry.summary: BTC ETFs: +$44m, ETH ETFs: -$133m. ETH falls as Grayscale ETF outflows continue. ETH ETFs still see $1bn of daily volume. Liquidations hit $250m in sell-off. ETH Open Interest hits ATH at CME. BTC whales have bought $23bn in July. SOL weekly active addresses hits ATH. Bitstamp to distribute Mt. Gox BTC today. Russia to legalise crypto mining & payments. Lummis set to introduce BTC strategic reserve bill. Harris will not be at Bitcoin Nashville. BTC going to $52m by 2050: VanEck. Hashdex file for mixed BTC & ETH ETF. Coinbase to make tokenised treasuries fund. Polymarket partners with Moonpay for on-ramp. Ferrari accepts crypto in Europe. Bitfarms stopped in poison-pill strategy. Riot buys another miner for $93m.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 165 - ETH ETFs TAKE IN 107M
entry.summary: BTC ETFs: -$78m, ETH ETFs: +$107m. BTC falls amid ETF outflows & Mt. Gox movements. ETH ETFs see ‘very solid’ first day $107m inflows. Grayscale ETH trust sees $484m outflow. ETH ETF volumes come out at 23% of BTC. Debate about whether strong flows will continue. SOL DEX volume continues to rise above ETH. Harris may also speak at Bitcoin Nashville. Harris could be far more open to Bitcoin: Cuban. BTC symbol lights up Vegas Sphere. Coinbase continues to pursue Gensler emails. dYdX explores sale of derivatives tech. dYdX site recovers after DNS attack. JD to create Hong Kong stablecoin. Bitwise uses ENS addresses for ETH ETFs. BlackRock applies for ENA cash allocation. Uber CEO wants to accept BTC.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 164 - ETH ETF DAY!
entry.summary: BTC ETF Flows: +$534m. ETH outperforms slightly as 9 ETFs set to launch. Grayscale moves $1bn ETH to Coinbase for outflows. Biggest BlackRock ETF inflow day in 4 months. Mt Gox moves $2.8bn BTC for distributions. US government moves $4m BTC to Coinbase. Bedford FC buys $4.5m BTC. Hamilton Lane launches private credit fund on SOL. CNBC discusses BTC reserve currency rumour. Polymarket sets another trading record. BlockFi administrator submits plan to repay customers. WLD denies insider trading and manipulation claims. India keeps high crypto taxes unchanged. Gate exchange exits Japan. Marathon Digital fined $138m for breaching NDA. HyperLend launches lending on HyperLiquid.

entry.title: Mika Shares How to Sell Crypto Using Kraken Wallet
entry.summary: Rug Radio creator Mika guides you through the process of selling crypto and transferring it back to your bank account.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 163 - JOEVER FOR BYEDEN
entry.summary: Crypto dips then bounces on Biden-Harris switch. SOL again leads, DEX volume eclipses ETH + BNB. Biden news had led to $67m liquidations. Democrats have chance to ‘regain crypto vote’. Mt Gox transfers to Bitstamp expected soon. Crypto sees $3.2bn fund inflows in 3 weeks. China company Boyaa buys $100m BTC. Polymarket saw $80m bets on Biden withdrawal. Polymarket 2024 volumes hit $500m. Elon appearance at Bitcoin Nashville rumoured. Combined SOL, BTC & ETH ETF coming: Geraci. Call skew heads to 2024 extremes in bullish sign. Plan B points to bullish setup in S2F model. Coinbase premium moves back to positive. Gensler likely resigns next year: 10x. Germany already lost $124m profit selling.

entry.title: What's the Meta? Do Crypto Degens Care About Being Scammed?
entry.summary: What's the Meta? With the rise of Pumpdotfun and rug pulls becoming a daily occurrence, why do crypto degens keep investing? Do these investors enjoy being scammed? It appears that people very often invest in meme coins that are very obviously going to rug pull. Once it happens, they just laugh it off on Twitter, is being scammed fun?!

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 162 - SOLANA LEADS THE CHARGE!
entry.summary: BTC ETF Inflows: +$85m. SOL leads majors ahead of ETH ETF. Rumours Trump may want BTC in strategic reserve. Trump BTC round-table tickets going for $845k. Polymarket hits volume record of $20m. ETH ETFs will get steady capital: Binance CEO. Winklevii donate $1m to try and unseat Warren. Tornado sees $1.9bn volume resurgence. New overlay attacks growing in crypto. Messari co-founder faces backlash on views. Raydium integrates with Moonpay. Tencent leads investment round in Chainbase. ZA Bank partners with stablecoin issuers.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 161 - THE BIG WIF COMEBACK?
entry.summary: BTC ETF Inflows: +$53m. Crypto remains stable despite macro sell-off. ETH ETF providers undercut each other on fees. Grayscale keeps 2.5% high fee, launches mini-fund. Grayscale launches ‘Decentralised AI Fund’. Dimon may be ‘changing tune’ on Bitcoin. Many alts now bounced 50-90% from lows. Vote implies 55% of Mt. Gox depositors won’t sell. BlockFi to make creditor distributions this month. WazirX exchanges sees $230m suspected breach. Vitalik warns against voting ‘pro-crypto’. Vitalik & Autism Capital trade barbs. Bitcoin Magazine to hold pro-Trump fundraiser. State Street explore blockchain payments. UPbit sees 44% monthly drop in volume.
